Subjective: Neck spot, ~2 weeks. Started as wound/insect bite, thought wart, now uncertain. Scabs fall off intermittently. Swollen, redder, itchy. Raised ~0.5 cm, pinkish-red with redder center. Intermittent flaking. No pain. No similar spots elsewhere. No known skin cancer family hx (except sun-related). Worried about skin cancer after online search. Knee pain after running, months duration, lasts few days, not severe. Soccer okay. Prefers freezing for neck spot. Wants neck spot removed. Wants knee pain addressed later.
Objective: Neck spot: Raised ~0.5 cm, pinkish-red, redder center. No current scab/flaking visible. No lymphadenopathy. Neck otherwise clear except freckles.
Assessment: Neck spot: Differential includes pyogenic granuloma, atypical mole, insect bite reaction. Rule out malignancy. Knee pain: Likely exertional, etiology unclear.
Plan:
1. E-consultation with dermatologist for neck spot. 
2. Patient to text photo of neck spot to provider. 
3. Provider to call patient Friday between 12:00-13:30 (or leave voicemail) for dermatologist's advice. 
4. Discuss treatment options (freezing preferred by patient) based on dermatologist's recommendation. 
5. Schedule separate appointment for knee pain evaluation.
